note.p: Education: Emmanuel College, Cambridge; BA (1624/5), MA (1628), BD (1635), DD (Lit. Reg. 1661)

Career: Vicar of Hatfield Peveril, Essex (to 1638); Rector of Woodham Walter (1647); Chaplain to Charles II (1666); Prebendary of Canterbury (1667); Professor of Arabic at Cambridge (1666); Rector of Higham Gobion, Bedfordshire; spent Â£12,000 on the publication of his 'Lexicon Heptaglotton', which left him so impoverished that he was imprisoned for debt (1667); also assisted in the compilation of the Polyglot Bible; bequeathed his collection of oriental manuscripts to Cambridge University Library
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Venn; Hunter
